cause: Poisoned by phosphine gas created by mixing red phosphorus with hot water to save the lives of Walter White and Jesse Pinkman. ("Pilot")
Strangled to death with a bicycle lock for trying to stab Walter White. ("...and the Bag's in the River")
Beaten to death for "disrespecting" Tuco Salamanca in front of Walter White and Jesse Pinkman, later succumbed to these injuries. ("Seven Thirty-Seven")
last_words: "No Tuco, come on, I'm just...I'm just saying."

cause: Accidentally crushed his arm by a settling car in a junkyard while moving No-Doze's body, which partially severed his arm and caused him to bleed to death. ("Seven Thirty-Seven")
Shot in the forehead during a shootout with Hank Schrader. ("Grilled")
Stabbed during the theft of an ATM. ("Peekaboo")
Head crushed with an ATM for insulting his wife. ("Peekaboo")
Decapitated with a machete for being a DEA informant. ("Negro y Azul")
Blown up with a bomb placed on a tortoise. ("Negro y Azul")
Shot several times in the abdomen and in the back for dealing on rival territory. ("Mandala")
responsible: Tomás Cantillo, on orders from the Rival Dealers

cause: Asphyxiated on her own vomit while on heroin. Allowed to die by Walter White because of the threat she posed to his business and relationship with Jesse Pinkman. ("Phoenix")
responsible: Herself, via being inadvertently flipped onto her back by Walter White

death: 167 unnamed passengers on the Wayfarer 515 and JM 21 flights
cause: Mid-air collision inadvertently caused by Donald Margolis, who was suffering emotional strain after the death of his daughter. ("ABQ")
responsible: Donald Margolis (by extension of Walter White's actions)

cause: Shot at close proximity, then left in the back of a truck while it was set afire. Olive Oil was killed for recognizing Leonel and Marco Salamanca as cartel members, and the other passengers were killed to cover up. ("No Más")
last_words:
"¿Qué tiene en la punta? Un poco de plata..."
("Hey, what's on the toes there? Little silver...") (Olive Oil) Unknown/Varies (Others)

cause: Shot in the back while running away, then in the head to finish him. Killed to cover up the murder of Olive Oil and the other passengers. ("No Más")
last_words: "What the hell's going on in there?"

cause: Killed in an unspecified manner, possibly shot or struck with an axe. Killed so Leonel and Marco Salamanca could take residence in her house. ("Sunset")
Struck in the back with an axe for investigating the murder of Mrs. Peyketewa. ("Sunset")
Shot once in the chest and head at point blank range for being present during the assassination attempt of Hank Schrader. ("One Minute")
Shot once in the head with a hollow point bullet after attempting to murder Hank Schrader. ("One Minute")
responsible: Hank Schrader, via manipulation by Gustavo Fring

cause: Poisoned with an unknown substance to prevent Juan Bolsa from finding out Gustavo Fring sanctioned the hit on Hank Schrader. ("I See You")
responsible: Mike Ehrmantraut, on orders from Gustavo Fring

cause: Shot repeatedly after federales were lured to Juan Bolsa's home by Gustavo Fring. ("I See You")
responsible: Mexican federales, via manipulation by Gustavo Fring

cause: Shot repeatedly after federales were lured to his home by Gustavo Fring. ("I See You")
responsible: Mexican federales, via manipulation by Gustavo Fring

cause: Unknown (presumably shot). Possibly killed to tie up loose ends related to Gustavo Fring's use of children in his business. ("Half Measures")
responsible: Rival Dealers, possibly on orders from Gustavo Fring

cause: Ran over by a car and then shot once in the head to save the life of Jesse Pinkman. ("Half Measures")
Shot repeatedly to save Duane Chow. ("Full Measure")
responsible: Mike Ehrmantraut, on orders from Gustavo Fring in order to save/with assistance from Duane Chow

cause: Shot once in the face to save the life of Walter White. ("Full Measure")
responsible: Jesse Pinkman, on orders from Walter White

cause: Throat slit with a boxcutter, bled to death. Killed for being a risk to Gustavo Fring's business by being spotted at the scene of Gale Boetticher's murder. ("Box Cutter")
last_words: "The steps never change, and I know every step."

cause: Shot at close proximity during a Los Pollos Hermanos truck robbery. ("Bullet Points")
Shot to death for attempting to rob a Los Pollos Hermanos truck. ("Bullet Points")
Shot multiple times during a Los Pollos Hermanos truck robbery. ("Cornered")
Suffocated by exhaust fumes while locked in the back of a Los Pollos Hermanos truck during a robbery. ("Cornered")
Shot once in the head for offending Don Eladio. ("Hermanos")
last_words:
"¡Por favor, se lo ju-!"
("¡I swear to God!")

cause: Shot by a sniper rifle during an attempt to take out Gus Fring's employees. ("Bug")

death: 10 Cartel members, including Don Paco, Don Cesar, Don Renaldo, Don Artuno, Don Cisco, Don Luis, Don Escalada, Benicio Fuentes and Miguel 	 	 	 		 		 		 			Overhead view of the 11 bodies (including Eladio and Gaff and excluding Miguel in the house)
cause: Poisoned tequila, killed so Gustavo Fring could destroy the Cartel. ("Salud")
Garroted with fiberwire so he could not interfere with Gustavo Fring's murder of cartel leaders. ("Salud")
responsible: Mike Ehrmantraut, on orders from Gustavo Fring

cause: Poisoned tequila, both to destroy the Cartel and as revenge for the murder of Max Arciniega. ("Salud")
Shot several times in the chest and abdomen so Gustavo Fring, Mike Ehrmantraut, and Jesse Pinkman could escape. ("Salud")
Suicide bombed by a pipe bomb detonated from a wheelchair bell to kill Gustavo Fring to avenge the murders of Hector Salamanca's family members and Cartel allies. ("Face Off")
Blown up by a pipe bomb detonated by a wheelchair bell for being present during Hector Salamanca's suicide bombing. ("Face Off")
responsible: Hector Salamanca (with assistance from Walter White)

cause: Right side of face almost completely blown off by a pipe bomb detonated by a wheelchair bell. Several third degree burns on skin. Killed in revenge for destroying the Cartel and killing the last of the Salamancas. ("Face Off")
responsible: Hector Salamanca (with assistance from Walter White)
last_words: "Last chance to look at me, Hector."

death: Two superlab guards, including Gus' Operative
cause: Shot several times with a .38 snubnosed revolver to save the life of Jesse Pinkman. ("Face Off")
last_words:
"What, you got a problem with stairs?" (first guard)
Unknown (second guard)

cause: Committed suicide to avoid criminal charges connected to Gustavo Fring. Placed one end of a defibrillator in his mouth and the other over his heart, electrocuting himself to death. ("Madrigal")
Shot once in the head to fulfill a hit contract. ("Madrigal")
responsible: Chris Mara on orders from Lydia Rodarte-Quayle

cause: Shot repeatedly in the chest with a silenced pistol for attempting to kill Mike Ehrmantraut. ("Madrigal")
Shot once in the chest with a pistol for being present during Walter White's train robbery. ("Dead Freight")
Shot once in the gut with a .357 caliber revolver, bled out. Killed for refusing to give the names of his men to Walter White and insulting him. ("Say My Name")
last_words: "Shut the fuck up, and let me die in peace."

cause: Stabbed to death to cover up involvement with Walter White's business. ("Gliding Over All")
responsible: Prison inmate members of Jack Welker's Gang, on orders from Jack Welker who was contracted by Walter White

cause: Doused in rubbing alcohol, set on fire and burned alive to cover up involvement with Walter White's business. ("Gliding Over All")
responsible: Prison inmate members of Jack Welker's Gang, on orders from Jack Welker who was contracted by Walter White

death: Nine of Declan's men, including his cook
cause: Shot repeatedly for refusing to cooperate with Lydia Rodarte-Quayle. ("Buried")
responsible: Jack Welker's Gang, on orders from Lydia Rodarte-Quayle and Jack Welker

cause: Shot once in the head for refusing to cooperate with Lydia Rodarte-Quayle. ("Buried")
responsible: Jack Welker, on orders from Lydia Rodarte-Quayle

cause: Shot several times during a shootout with Jack Welker's gang. ("Ozymandias")
Shot once in the head after a shootout with Jack Welker's gang. ("Ozymandias")
Shot once in the head to punish Jesse Pinkman. ("Granite State")

death: Six gang members, including Kenny, Matt, Frankie, and Lester
cause: Shot repeatedly by remote-activated M60 machine gun in revenge for stealing Walter White's money and murdering Hank Schrader. ("Felina")
last_words:
"Yeah, Toddy, get them both off!" (Kenny)"Yeah, you'll get them back. Just relax." (Frankie)
Unknown/Varies (Others)

cause: Strangled to death with chain shackles, neck broken in revenge for murdering Andrea Cantillo and for imprisoning and torturing Jesse Pinkman. ("Felina")

Shot once in the head, after being mortally wounded by 2 or 3 shots from a remote-activated M60 machine gun. Killed to avenge the murder of Hank Schrader and save Jesse Pinkman from captivity. ("Felina")
Fatally poisoned with ricin for betraying and working against Walter White. ("Felina",  "El Camino")
Accidentally hit by a ricocheting bullet fired by his remote-activated M60 machine gun, bled out. ("Felina")
